intro: Draba oreades, commonly known as the alpine whitlow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky, alpine environments. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba oreades is adapted to cold, high-altitude climates and is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and Asia.
